I downloaded MKV to DVD converter, so i could burn it to a DVD, but it´s a trial version, and it says, that it only supports a limited amount of subs, anyone know wich (can´t see it anywhere) or anyone know of a better converter??

Although picture quality seems amazingly perfect (checked first minute), this encode won't be played back using DXVA hardware acceleration on my Ati HD 3200/780G so probably it won't work with any hardware playback.

Conclusion: it is a very good rip! Plays fine in Media Player Classic. But not compliant to DXVA standards, therefore your CPU will be needed for playback. 
Wich is still fine! But I want silent pc during playback, thus prefer something that can be played back by (integrated) videocard (via dxva/Media Player Classic Home Cinema/XBMC). 
Too bad! thanks! Will try the 6700 MB version, a lot bigger unfortunately. If I see no quality difference on my 720P I might still watch this 4,5GB version.
